    • Constructor Detail

      • HttpServer

        @SafeVarargs
public HttpServer(Channel componentChannel,
                               Channel networkChannel,
                               java.lang.Class<? extends Request>... fallbacks)
        Create a new server that uses the networkChannel for network level I/O.

        As a convenience the server can provide fall back handlers for the specified types of requests. The fall back handler simply returns 404 ( "Not found").

        Parameters:
        componentChannel - this component's channel
        networkChannel - the channel for network level I/O
        fallbacks - the requests for which a fall back handler is provided

      • HttpServer

        @SafeVarargs
public HttpServer(Channel componentChannel,
                               java.net.SocketAddress serverAddress,
                               java.lang.Class<? extends Request>... fallbacks)
        Create a new server that creates its own Server with the given address and uses it for network level I/O.
        Parameters:
        componentChannel -

    • Method Detail

      • onAccepted

        @DynamicHandler
public void onAccepted(Accepted<ManagedByteBuffer> event)
        Creates a new downstream connection as LinkedIOSubchannel of the network connection, a HttpRequestDecoder and a HttpResponseEncoder.
        Parameters:
        event - the accepted event

      • onInput

        @DynamicHandler
public void onInput(Input<ManagedByteBuffer> event)
        Handles data from the client. The data is send through the HttpRequestDecoder and events are sent downstream according to the decoding results.
        Parameters:
        event -

      • onResponse

        @Handler
public void onResponse(Response event)
                         throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Handles a response event from downstream by sending it through an HttpResponseEncoder that generates the data (encoded information) and sends it upstream with Output events. Depending on the response data, subsequent Output events and an EndOfResponse event targeted at the HttpServer can follow.
        Parameters:
        event - the response event
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • onOutput

        @Handler
public void onOutput(Output<ManagedBuffer<?>> event)
                       throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Receives the message body of a response. A Response event that has a message body can be followed by one or more Output events from downstream that contain the data. An EndOfResponse event signals the end of the message body.
        Parameters:
        event - the event with the data
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • onEndOfResponse

        @Handler
public void onEndOfResponse(EndOfResponse event)
                              throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Signals the end of a response message's body.
        Parameters:
        event - the event
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • onClose

        @Handler
public void onClose(Close event)
                      throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Handles a close event from downstream by flushing any remaining data and sending a Close event upstream.
        Parameters:
        event - the close event
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • onRequestCompleted

        @Handler
public void onRequestCompleted(Request.Completed event)
                                 throws java.lang.InterruptedException,
                                        java.text.ParseException
        Checks whether the request has been handled (status code of response has been set). If not, send the default response ("Not implemented") to the client.
        Parameters:
        event - the request completed event
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        java.text.ParseException

      • onOptions

        @Handler(priority=-2147483648)
public void onOptions(OptionsRequest event)
                                              throws java.text.ParseException
        Provides a fallback handler for an OPTIONS request with asterisk. Simply responds with "OK".
        Parameters:
        event -
        Throws:
        java.text.ParseException
